intro: Icacorea herbert-smithii, commonly known as the Herbert-Smith's hakea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, attracting nectar-feeding insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
